. Thanks for doing this! I ended up creating one a little more consistent with the rest of the batch. Also, have it going clockwise since that seems more common.

. @Osifer This is a great idea! I ended up just using the SVG icon itself instead of adding images to the repo. This makes it a little easier to manage and one less thing to update if things change.
Markdown is pretty limited and this is a short-term solution. I plan on creating a separate landing page to make it easier to Copy and Paste soon.

. @rhysd Looks pretty rad. Thanks!. @vanthome This has been added with the latest version.. Since you are rendering the SVG as an image you won't be able to manipulate fills or stroke from DOM.. @saboorazizi You can load the entire SVG library once (even as n external file for cache advantages), and use the  tag to show the icons you want. Demo:
https://cdn.rawgit.com/danklammer/bytesize-icons/master/examples/bytesize-symbols.html
<use xlink:href="/icons/bytesize-icons.svg#i-search" />
Note: This doesn't work for IE, so you'd you need to use a polyfill like SVG4Everybody:
https://github.com/jonathantneal/svg4everybody. Whoops. It's been updated. Thanks for addressing.. @qodo Added—check release v1.3!. Still a work in progress, but you can use this:

ghost:
That line is known as the Notice Condition. If you're interested in understanding the MIT license Kyle's writing is worth your time. Here's an excerpt from the Warranty Disclaimer section:

Lawyers have long suffered under the delusion that writing anything in ALL-CAPS meets the conspicuous requirement. That isn’t true.

Does anyone knows a way so that the icon will inherit the colour?.
